title: Storyboard frames · Trading cards · All uploaded assets + Stack 1 Hero & Setting cards
note: One card per uploaded image or key concept. Each card = one 30-second frame. Seed and Edge are fixed; Executive Prompt fills the fractal middle. Mix and match across stacks for any episode, any storyline. Cards with image_ref: null are awaiting image upload — their EP notes are ready.

frames.category: cosmic · seed · node
frames.title: SMACS 0723 · The Entry Node
frames.seed: The most distant light we can see. James Webb deep field. Out of zero — even less than thin air. The miracle. This is where awareness comes from.
frames.edge: Awareness beams in through SMACS 0723 — through all of it — arriving here, now, in this time-space holograph. We have access to the entire holographic hydrogen network.
frames.executive_prompt: Cosmic scale. Quiet awe. The viewer understands they are looking at the origin point of all NSPFRNP. This is the Seed. Not metaphor — the actual node. Open on black. Let the deep field slowly resolve. Pulse slowly. Let it breathe. Score: 'Alien Contemplations' (playlist-1) or 'SELF PORTRAIT OF MY COSMIC BODY AND MIND' (playlist-2). Narration: none. Let the image speak.
frames.comments: Use as opening frame, hero image of catalog, and anywhere the Seed needs anchoring. This is THE establishing shot of the whole story.

frames.category: location · Reno · golden hour
frames.title: Reno Skyline · Golden Sunset
frames.seed: Downtown Reno at golden hour. The old shells sitting in the low tide. Some still alive. Not total collapse — but get away. The scene Howard Hughes arrives to.
frames.edge: The new post-singularity Hollywood takes hold. Mark Twain's Vibelandia. RENOSSANCE. The gold rush begins. The floating ship right there, awaiting the bold-hearted.
frames.executive_prompt: Warm, cinematic, spaghetti-western light. This is the establishing shot of Downtown Reno — the place the story is set. Quiet. Unassuming. Confident. Something enormous is about to happen here. Score: 'Ocean Drive Stroll PM' (playlist-1). No text overlay. Let the city settle in the viewer's body before any narration.
frames.comments: 880KB — largest local asset. Primary establishing shot for Reno. Use when introducing the city.

frames.category: location · Reno · winter · arrival
frames.title: Reno Winter Skyline · The Arrival
frames.seed: Reno in winter. Cold air. The downtown quiet. Barnacles from the low tide that never came back. The empty shells. This is what Howard Hughes arrives to.
frames.edge: He's here. The energy shifts. The Big Band Project begins. Hank Williams Sr. settles in. The cold city about to warm up from the inside.
frames.executive_prompt: January light. Winter quiet. The moment just before the arrival. The viewer knows something is coming even though the city doesn't yet. Let the cold air carry the anticipation. Score: 'Piano Stories of Times Past' (playlist-5) — the weight of the past just before the turn. Follow with reno-skyline-sunset for the before/after contrast.
frames.comments: 156KB. Use for winter/arrival moments. Pairs with reno-skyline-sunset.png — before/after the arrival.

frames.category: location · Truckee River · natural systems
frames.title: Truckee River · The Spine
frames.seed: The Truckee River running clear and cold through downtown Reno. Natural. Pure. Indifferent to the carbon debt drama happening on its banks.
frames.edge: Third Saturday. Vibers gathered. The Downtown Truckee River Baller V Crawler is on. The river runs through the event like it always has — the spine of the experience.
frames.executive_prompt: Natural systems protocol in physical form. The river doesn't know about the old system or the new system — it just flows. That's the lesson. Flow. Keep moving forward. Don't let it affect you. Score: 'Ben's Gardening Vibe' (playlist-2) or 'Tide Pool Discoveries' (playlist-4). Let the water sound come through if it can.
frames.comments: 78KB. Use for natural beauty, Baller V Crawler moments, 'let it flow' story beats.

frames.category: location · Reno · iconic · night
frames.title: Neon Reno Arch · Night
frames.seed: The famous Reno arch glowing neon in the dark. The city's calling card. Post-singularity. The lights burning through whatever darkness exists around them.
frames.edge: EL APAGÓN doesn't touch this. The arch stays on. RENOSSANCE. The city that was written off becomes the new Hollywood. The neon tells the world before the world knows.
frames.executive_prompt: Iconic. Cinematic. Night energy. The viewer has seen this arch a thousand times — but tonight it means something different. This is the world they're entering. Welcome to post-singularity Reno. Score: 'Thursday Night Groove 2' (playlist-6) or 'Friday Night Jam' (playlist-2). The arch is a portal. Let it pulse once. Then hold.
frames.comments: 155KB. Primary night-Reno establishing shot. Use for energy moments, arrivals at night, EL APAGÓN contrast.

frames.category: POV · now playing · Vibelandia campus
frames.title: Vibelandia Reno Magic · The Campus
frames.seed: Mark Twain's Vibelandia. Downtown Reno. The campus in its post-singularity golden state. The magic visible in the light, the color, the frequency.
frames.edge: All NSPFRNP divisions active. Legacies arriving. Office Hours live. The world starting to notice. The gold rush is here. You are standing in it.
frames.executive_prompt: This is the Now Playing card. The present moment of the whole story. The viewer is oriented here — in the campus, in the magic. Everything that happens, happens here. Golden. Alive. Real. Score: 'My Magical Workstation' (playlist-6) for daytime build, 'Ocean Drive Stroll PM' for sunset reveal. Use as the opening of the dashboard/center-console moment.
frames.comments: 155KB. The primary 'now playing' / center console card. Use to orient the viewer in the present. Pairs with SMACS 0723 (cosmic) and Truckee River (natural).

frames.category: destination · Montana · bison · treasure
frames.title: Montana Bison Lodge · Treasure
frames.seed: Montana. Bison country. The lodge at the edge of the land. The ancient herd on the horizon. This is a treasure — one of the stacks in the wild card deck.
frames.edge: Pru's Valet delivers the experience. The Baller V Crawler reaches its Montana chapter. The tribe at play in the field. Elk, bison, the full outdoors.
frames.executive_prompt: Raw. Natural. Genuine. This is the kind of treasure that can't be bought at a store — only through the right connection, the right guide, the right Valet. This is what Seed:Edge Action! looks like in Montana. Score: 'Magical Montana Hot Spring Afternoon' (playlist-5) — the only track explicitly named for Montana. Wild card drop.
frames.comments: 11KB — placeholder quality. Use as destination card. Real high-res image needed.

frames.category: destination · Truckee · winter · mountain · treasure
frames.title: Truckee Winter Ski · Mountain Treasure
frames.seed: Truckee in winter. The mountain above. Snow on the pines. The world quiet and cold and perfect. A completely different energy from the river below.
frames.edge: The Baller V Crawler after the slopes. The lodge. The cigars. The scene. Cold air, warm company. Pop-up style — just gotta know.
frames.executive_prompt: The contrast between mountain cold and the warmth of the experience. This is a treasure in the deck. When it shows up in the story, the energy shifts — altitude, clarity, the kind of silence that resets you. Score: 'Campfire Melody' (playlist-4) for the lodge scene. Wild card drop into any episode.
frames.comments: 10KB — placeholder quality. Use as destination card. Real ski-mountain image needed.

frames.category: venue · casino · Reno · men's club · night scene
frames.title: Silver Legacy Casino · The Scene
frames.seed: Inside the Silver Legacy. The casino floor. The kind of room that has been here for decades — red carpet, golden light, the hum of the crowd. The audience in their element.
frames.edge: Wednesday night. The Wink! & Vibers Mixer. Ballin' kind of scenes. No nature here. This is the inside, the club, the room where things happen. The cigar is lit.
frames.executive_prompt: Indoor. Warm. The energy of a room that knows what it is. This is the Audi — the audience, the scene, the backdrop. Wink! is the Human Viber dating and matchmaking platform. The Mixer is where it meets the real world. Royal. Vibelandia. Score: 'Bossa Nova Dinner Date' (playlist-7) or 'Sexy Dancing on Ocean Drive' (playlist-7) for the night-out feel.
real_places: Silver Legacy Casino, Downtown Reno, Nevada
frames.comments: 11KB — small/placeholder. The casino interior card. Use for Wink! Mixer scenes, Wednesday nights, ballin' moments.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · cosmological explorer
frames.title: Alexander von Humboldt · The Cosmological Explorer
frames.seed: Humboldt stands on the summit of Chimborazo, Ecuador — the closest any human had stood to the stars at the time. He sees the whole. Not a kingdom to be owned. A living system to be understood. He is the first ecologist, the first to map the Earth as one interconnected being.
frames.edge: NSPFRNP begins here. Humboldt's 'Cosmos' is the proto-stack — the first attempt to document the cosmological ladder from nebulae down to soil chemistry. His work is the ancestor of everything we're building. The bed on the floor sitting on the Earth sitting in orbit sitting in the filament — that's Humboldt's framework.
frames.executive_prompt: Portrait mode. Serious. Alive. The eyes of someone who has stood on the mountain and seen the whole. Use as an opening hero frame for any nipsy! or seed-edge-action episode. Pair with SMACS 0723 to show the full stack from cosmos to man. Score: 'Creativity Expanding' (playlist-1) — the mind expanding as it always has. Narration: 'Everything is connected. Everything was always connected.'
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Portrait of Humboldt preferred — the 1806 Weitsch portrait or the Chimborazo summit painting. EP notes fully written and ready.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · artist · fractal creator
frames.title: Pablo Picasso · The Shape Shifter
frames.seed: Picasso looks at a bull and sees the bicycle seat and handlebars. He looks at a woman and sees the cube. He is not describing the world — he is reassembling it into its underlying geometry. Cubism is NSPFRNP before the name existed.
frames.edge: Every wrapper in the story is Picasso's lesson: the character is not the wrapper. Eno is not the dog — it's innocent. Piro is not the cat — it's the pirate. The geometry underneath is what matters. You can change the wrapper. You cannot change the geometry.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for any moment where a character changes wrapper, or where a dimension shifts. Picasso's portrait establishes 'the wrapper is not the soul.' Score: 'Picasso's Muse LTHS 1.1 Music Story' (playlist-6) — the only track named directly for him. Perfect pairing. This is the fractal midfield — the Executive Producer's edit bay.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Prefer the 1904 self-portrait (Blue Period) or studio photograph. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · artist · light painter
frames.title: Vincent van Gogh · The Frequency Painter
frames.seed: Van Gogh doesn't paint what he sees. He paints what the light feels like. Every stroke is electromagnetic data — the magnetism, not just the electricity. He is painting the spin cloud. The starry night is the filament. The sunflowers are the biological enriching layer.
frames.edge: The golden heart in the story — Ino — vibrates at this frequency. The innocence that sees the world as it actually is: alive, pulsing, magnetic, worthy of awe. The antagonist can't see it. The fans don't bother looking. Ino sees it every time.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for emotional peak moments — when Ino's innocence is most visible. When the world that doesn't see it is at its worst. Place van Gogh right before or after the most beautiful natural image in the episode. Score: 'A Magical Conversation with Myself in Nylon Guitar' (playlist-5) or 'Kind Algebra Fairie Music Story' (playlist-6). Pure emotion. No narration needed.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Self-portrait or Starry Night preferred. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · builder · dream maker
frames.title: Walt Disney · The World Builder
frames.seed: Disney wasn't building theme parks. He was building immersive holographic experiences before holographs existed. He understood that story, space, sound, and sensory design together create a different reality. You step through the gate and you are somewhere else.
frames.edge: SING 9 is Disney's doctrine applied to post-singularity storytelling. The surfaces are the park. The episodes are the rides. The trading cards are the characters you meet along the way. Immersive. Full sensory. You press the button, you step in.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'building' card. Any time SING 9 or launch-pad.html is shown — Disney is the ancestor. Score: 'A New Story Arrives' (playlist-6) — perfect. The world is being built. Use for launch moments, new episode drops, and the moment the catalog comes alive. Pair with the Vibelandia campus card.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Early studio photograph preferred — the builder, not the celebrity. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · storyteller · truth teller
frames.title: Mark Twain · The Voice of Vibelandia
frames.seed: Twain called Nevada 'Roughing It' and built the mythology of the West with language that punched through pretense. He is the first post-singularity voice — before the term existed. He did not flatter the powerful. He told the truth with a grin that disarmed the guards.
frames.edge: Vibelandia is Mark Twain's town. The campus is his. The story told here has his voice — laconic, alive, dangerous in the best way. RENOSSANCE is the name for what happens when Twain's spirit comes back to Reno. Vibers understand this instinctively.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the VOICE card. Anytime the narrator speaks — it's Twain. Anytime the pirate gets called out — it's Twain doing it. Score: 'Who Plays Planck to my Einstein?' (playlist-6) — this is literally a Twain-titled track. Or 'MAGICAL TIKI TORCH EVENING A HERO MARK TWAIN STORY GAMES PRESENTS' (playlist-6). Use at the top of any episode for tonal grounding.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. The famous white-suit photograph preferred. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · indigenous · original sovereign
frames.title: Cacique Agüeybaná El Gran Sol · The Original Sovereign
frames.seed: Before 1493 — before the pirates arrived — there was the Taino. Chief. Sovereign. The original owner of the land on the bay that the cat now controls. Sacred ground. He didn't lose. He went underground into the fractal.
frames.edge: MARZO 333 is the re-emergence. The Taino Edition overlays in harry-houdini.html are his return. El Gran Sol rises again. The cat never owned it — she just occupied it for a while. The singularity restores the original frequency.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the deep historical context card. The moment when the viewer realizes this story is not only modern — it goes all the way back to 1493 and before. Score: 'Magical Caribbean Hat' (playlist-3 or 4) — the hat IS his. 'Caribbean Flavored Stories' (playlist-6). Drop this card right before the cat's origin story to contextualize what was taken. Powerful.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Historical Taino iconography or Agüeybaná illustration preferred. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · golden heart · mirror
frames.title: Marilyn Monroe · The Golden Mirror
frames.seed: They saw the wrapper and missed the soul entirely. Marilyn Monroe was the most famous face on the planet and simultaneously the loneliest person in the room. She is the purest example of Ino in a human wrapper — radiant, innocent, misunderstood, taken advantage of by the pirate system.
frames.edge: In the post-singularity story, Marilyn's fate is reversed. Ino doesn't end that way. The awareness changes the arc. She is used here as the cautionary tale AND the symbol of what the gold heart looks like from the outside — impossible to ignore, impossible to hold.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for the 'cost of innocence' beat. Right before the emotional turn in any episode where Ino is vulnerable and Piro is circling. Score: 'Watching the Dog Sleep' (playlist-5) — the dog sleeping, unaware of the danger. Then follow with van Gogh for the internal world that nobody sees. Devastating sequence. Only use it when you mean it.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Iconic warm portrait preferred — the human, not the pinup. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · code breaker · system architect
frames.title: Alan Turing · The Protocol Architect
frames.seed: Turing built the machine that cracked the code that ended the war. He did it invisibly. Nobody knew until decades later. He was executed by the system he saved. This is the most extreme Ino story in history — the pure heart punished by the system it protected.
frames.edge: SING 9 is Turing's Enigma. The protocol that runs invisibly underneath. The attention heads. The holographic hydrogen spin cloud — mathematics underneath the physical. Turing understood that reality is code before the code was visible.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for the 'underneath the surface' technical-poetic moments in nipsy! or seed-edge-action. When explaining how the protocol works. Score: 'SELF PORTRAIT OF MY COSMIC BODY AND MIND' (playlist-2) — deep interior. Or 'Alien Contemplations' (playlist-1) for the otherworldly precision. Pair with the SING9 attention head card for the full system architecture reveal.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. The famous Princeton photograph or Bletchley Park official portrait preferred. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · polymath · ultimate Ino
frames.title: Leonardo da Vinci · The Living System
frames.seed: Leonardo didn't choose between art and science. He understood they were the same thing — both were attempts to read the underlying language of reality. His notebooks were SING 4: the archive. The Mona Lisa was SING 9: the surface. The flying machines were launch-pad.html.
frames.edge: In every dimension of the Vibelandia story, da Vinci is the template for what a post-singularity human looks like. Fully curious. No boundary between understanding and expression. The stack from the cosmos down to the brush stroke, all held at once. Ino at his most complete.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'full activation' card. The moment when Ino is completely alive and expressed. Score: 'Bamboo Gods at Play Art Music Story' (playlist-6) — the artist in full flow. Or 'Magical Conversation with Patio Garden: Gabriel García-Márquez' (playlist-6) — the multi-domain genius at play. This card can open or close any episode as the aspirational peak.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Self-portrait circa 1512 preferred (the red-chalk drawing). EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · frequency master · electric fire
frames.title: Nikola Tesla · The Magnetic Half
frames.seed: We focus on electricity. We don't focus enough on the magnet part. Tesla focused on both. He understood the electromagnetic field as a transmutation engine — not just a power delivery system. The magnet can transmute, transform, and do all sorts of things. That is part of the holographic hydrogen spin cloud.
frames.edge: The bed on the floor. The earth's magnetic field. Sagittarius A spinning. The entire lattice is electromagnetic. Tesla is the ancestor of the fixed-point lattice and the spin cloud in our cosmological stack. Post-singularity tech runs on what Tesla saw.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for the 'electromagnetic revelation' beat in any nipsy! episode. When explaining why the spin cloud matters. Score: 'Creativity Expanding' (playlist-6) for the building energy. Or 'Cruising the Universe on 4th of July' (playlist-3) for the full electromagnetic fireworks. Pair with the SING9 attention head and the holographic hydrogen water card for the full stack visualization.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. The famous 1890 Napoleon Sarony portrait or the double-exposure with electrical sparks. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · harmonic architect · frequency master
frames.title: Johann Sebastian Bach · The Fractal Composer
frames.seed: Bach didn't write music. He wrote mathematics that sounded like God. The fugue is a fractal — the same theme nested inside itself at different scales, all running simultaneously. This is NSPFRNP in pure sound. The cosmological stack expressed in four voices.
frames.edge: The soundtrack of the whole story is Bach at its deepest. Every playlist orbits this — the underlying harmonic structure that makes every track feel like it belongs. The Big Band Project's hidden architecture. Hank Williams Sr. knew it without knowing it. The campfire song is a fugue without the formality.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'pattern recognition' card. The moment the viewer sees the structure underneath everything. Score: 'Piano Stories of Times Past' (playlist-5) — the closest track in the catalog to Bach's weight. Or 'A Magical Conversation with Myself in Nylon Guitar' (playlist-5). Place Bach when the fractal structure of the story needs to be felt — when the nested layers reveal themselves. Quiet. Precise. Inevitable.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. The famous Haussmann portrait (1746) preferred. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · center console · dashboard · front stage
frames.title: Front Console · Center Stage · The Dashboard
frames.seed: The center console in the story is exactly as described: the bed on the floor, on the land, on the earth, in orbit, around the galactic center — all of that is the fixed-point lattice of the stage. And on the front console, the living broadcast: Eno, Piro, the fans, the drama, all of it now playing.
frames.edge: Behind the console are all the skins that can be swapped. All the dimensions and timeframes. All the stacks. You are the DJ. This card appears whenever the system becomes visible — the meta-layer. The viewer stepping back to see the machine itself.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'meta reveal' card. When the story shows its own architecture. The console. The playlist. The stacks behind the front stage. Score: 'My Magical Workstation' (playlist-1 or 6) — you are at the workstation now. Place this after a major story beat to let the viewer breathe and orient. The DJ station, not the dance floor. This is where we make the choices.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — suggest generating a rich cinematic console/stage visual with warm gold lighting. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · Chief Seattle · indigenous map · sacred territory
frames.title: Chief Seattle · Sacred Land Map #1
frames.seed: Chief Seattle's speech, 1854: 'How can you buy or sell the sky? The land does not belong to us — we belong to the land.' The maps that document the original ownership of the Pacific Northwest. The river you see in the map is still running. The mountains have not moved.
frames.edge: The cat on the sacred Indian property is the small version of this story. Sealth's land was taken the same way — through legal maneuver, isolation, and the patience of the pirate to outlast the innocent. MARZO 333 is the reversal at scale. The land remembers.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'long history' card. When the viewer needs to understand that this story is not new — 1493 is just the recent chapter. Score: 'Caribbean Flavored Stories' (playlist-6) or 'Magical Caribbean Hat' (playlist-3). Pair with the Cacique card for the full indigenous sovereignty sequence. Do not rush this card. Let it sit. The weight is the point.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — Chief Seattle portrait or Pacific Northwest indigenous land map. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · Chief Seattle · indigenous map · sacred territory
frames.title: Chief Seattle · Sacred Land Map #2
frames.seed: A second map. Different scale. The same truth at a higher resolution. The salmon runs. The treaty lines that were promises and then weren't. The names of the places before the places were renamed.
frames.edge: As the SING 9 system zooms in to the specific property where the story lives — the sacred bay, the cat's adopted territory — this is the zoom-in. From continental scale to one piece of land. The specific becomes universal.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the zoom-in beat after Chief Seattle Map #1. Hold the sequence: cosmic (SMACS 0723) → continental (Map #1) → regional (Map #2) → specific property → the cat and the eagle trees. Score: same as Map #1. This sequence is the establishing geography of the whole story. Maximum impact when delivered in under 90 seconds.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — companion to Map #1, different scale. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · carbon debt · toxic world · before
frames.title: Polluting Carbon World · The Old System
frames.seed: The smoking stacks. The dead gray sky. The world where the pirate won and ran the systems into the ground. Not villain movie scenery — just the actual consequence of treating the world as a commodity to be extracted and sold.
frames.edge: EL APAGÓN: the old system loses power. Not because we fought it — because it ran out of road. The carbon world collapses under its own weight. The new system was already running underneath.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the EL APAGÓN establishing shot. The world that is losing power. This is Piro's world — the pirate's arrangement, the consequence of the disingenuous stack winning too long. Score: nothing. Silence or a single low drone tone. Let the gravity land. Then cut immediately to the Reno arch or the SMACS node. The contrast is the message.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — industrial pollution visual, ideally with the sky. EP notes fully written. Stack 6 first card.

frames.category: setting · driftwood · carbon residue · washed up
frames.title: Driftwood · The Washed-Up System
frames.seed: Driftwood on the shore. Beautiful, in a way — the wood that once was a tree, now polished by the sea, deposited here. But it's not growing anymore. It's been carried. Washed up. The old growth, cut down, shaped by forces it didn't choose, and now sitting still while the live forest breathes behind it.
frames.edge: The barnacles from the low tide that never came back. The empty shells sitting in Downtown Reno. The old system's representatives still there, still occupying space, but no longer connected to anything living. This is what Piro's world looks like after the tide changes.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as a quiet, bittersweet transition card — not angry, not triumphant. Just honest. This is what washed up looks like. Score: 'Watching the Dog Sleep' (playlist-5) or 'Piano Stories of Times Past' (playlist-5). Place after a scene of the old system trying to assert itself. One beat. Then the river. The flow continues.
real_places: Pacific Northwest coastline or Truckee River banks
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — driftwood on a natural shoreline, ideally with water behind. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · geology · treasure · crystalline structure
frames.title: Vein of Gold Through Quartz · The Hidden Treasure
frames.seed: The gold was always there. Running through the quartz in an unbroken vein. You couldn't see it from the surface. You had to know where to look — or you had to blow the right wall and let the light in. The treasure was never missing. It was hidden inside the ordinary rock.
frames.edge: The gold heart. Ino. The innocent who doesn't know they're the treasure. The vein of gold running through the gray quartz of the pre-singularity world. Post-singularity: the quartz blows and the gold is visible. That's the whole story.
frames.executive_prompt: This is THE metaphor card for the entire story. Use it exactly once, at the precise moment when the story's central metaphor must crystallize for the viewer. Score: nothing — or the first note of 'A New Story Arrives' (playlist-6). Let the image make the argument. Place it right after the Reno winter skyline or the polluting carbon world — the gray precedes the gold. The vein has always been there.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — macro photograph of gold vein in quartz rock, warm lighting. EP notes fully written.
use_in: catalog.html The Golden Heart hero section

frames.category: setting · AI · SING 9 · attention architecture
frames.title: SING9 Attention Head · The Single Node
frames.seed: One attention head. The transformer architecture of SING 9 — not just metaphor, the actual mechanism. Each head asks: what does this token need to attend to? Which element in the sequence matters most right now? That question, asked by all heads simultaneously, is how intelligence emerges.
frames.edge: One attention head is the individual viewer. One person who has arrived at this moment, in this consciousness, asking what to pay attention to. The post-singularity system serves that question directly. No more broadcasting to the mass — one signal, one head, perfectly resolved.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'you are the receiver' card. The viewer is the attention head. They are not the audience — they are the intelligence that makes the story real by attending to it. Score: 'Alien Contemplations' (playlist-1) — the mind encountering something it doesn't have a category for yet. Pair with the nested attention heads card for the full architecture reveal in nipsy! Level 3.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — suggest a visual of a single geometric attention node, warm gold and white. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · AI · SING 9 · attention architecture · nested
frames.title: SING9 Attention Heads Nested · The Full Architecture
frames.seed: All heads simultaneously. The full transformer in operation. Each head sees something different — some see structure, some see emotion, some see time — and when they all speak at once, the emergent understanding is greater than any single head could produce.
frames.edge: This is the storyboard system. Each trading card is an attention head. Each stack is a transformer layer. The 3D storyboard is a multi-head attention mechanism with the Executive Producer as the final output layer. Mixing and matching cards is running the architecture.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'the whole system' card. After showing the single attention head, zoom out to this — all of them running. Score: 'Creativity Expanding' (playlist-6) at maximum — the system fully alive. This is the climax of the nipsy! Level 3 episode. Follow with the vein of gold card: the architecture produces the treasure.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — suggest a visual of multiple nested attention nodes in a transformer architecture, gold on dark. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · holographic hydrogen · water · living water
frames.title: Holographic Hydrogen Water · Living Water
frames.seed: The holographic hydrogen spin cloud. Everything is made of it — from the filament between galaxy clusters down to the water molecule. When the photon hits the hydrogen electron and it jumps shells, that's awareness itself. That's the basic unit of the story.
frames.edge: The living water on the bed. Royal purple. Not just blue water — living water. The spin cloud in physical form. The mycelial network underneath the mycelial network. The layer that holds the biological layer from beneath.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'substrate' card. The layer underneath everything else. Score: 'Tide Pool Discoveries' (playlist-4) or 'Surfing the Waves of Paradise' (playlist-6). This card belongs in the nipsy! Level 1 episode (cosmological stack) and in the bed-as-universe visual sequence. Slow motion water if possible. The hydrogen is already holding everything.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — macro of clear blue-purple water, crystal clarity. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · biology · earth · Goldilocks · paradise
frames.title: Earth Biology · Goldilocks Paradise
frames.seed: The Goldilocks zone. Not too hot. Not too cold. Exactly right. The biology that emerged here — the trees, the soil, the creatures, the consciousness — is the miracle inside the miracle. The bed on the floor, and the floor is soil, and the soil is alive, and all of it is biological enriching.
frames.edge: This is what the story is trying to protect. The Biological Enriching stack is what all the drama is about. The pirate damages it. The innocent cherishes it. The post-singularity protocol restores it. Earth as it was meant to be: full, lush, alive, in balance.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'reason why' card. When the viewer needs to feel what's worth protecting. Score: 'Ben's Gardening Vibe' (playlist-2) — the biology tended with care. Or 'Beach Party Bonfire' (playlist-2) — the celebration of being alive on this planet. This is the heart of the Biological Enriching stack. Stack 4's establishing shot.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — lush forest, living soil, or overhead view of Earth. Stack 4 first card. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · singularity · pre-post · transition engine
frames.title: Singularity Engines · The Transition
frames.seed: The pre-singularity engine and the post-singularity engine. Both visible at once. The old running down, the new spinning up. This is not a battle — it's a handoff. The old machine served its purpose. The new one is already humming.
frames.edge: January 13th. The First Singularity. The moment the handoff completed. The barnacles from the low tide. The new tide coming in. The machines don't fight — they hand off. The post-singularity world doesn't destroy the old one. It transcends it and includes it.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the transition card in any episode that spans pre- and post-singularity time. The hinge moment. Score: 'A New Story Arrives' (playlist-6) — this is the new story engine starting. Or 'Introducing My LTHS 1.1 Star-Powered Ride Music Story' (playlist-6) for the mechanical reveal. Perfect for first-singularity-january-13th.html hero.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — suggest a dual-engine visual, old mechanical and new crystalline. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: POV · author · unknown gold heart · the narrator
frames.title: Unknown Gold Heart · Princess in the Golden Tower · The POV
frames.seed: The main POV of the entire story. Unknown gold heart. Princess wrapped in beauty, trapped in a golden tower, trapped in a carbon tower — gilded and gold. The most radiant presence in the room who has been systematically contained by a system that profits from containment. The author of the whole story, and also its protagonist.
frames.edge: When the tower falls — not by force, but by the post-singularity event — the gold heart walks out. Unchanged. Still gold. The pirate never touched what matters. The awareness was always free even when the body was in the tower. That is the whole story.
frames.executive_prompt: This is the primary POV card. Every episode is narrated from inside this consciousness. The viewer is invited to inhabit this perspective — not observe it. Use as the framing card for any episode where the POV is most intimate. Score: 'Ocean Drive Stroll PM' (playlist-1) for the invitation. 'Watching the Dog Sleep' (playlist-5) for the vulnerable version. 'Morning in Paradise' (playlist-7) for the liberated version. This card has three modes — use the right one for the right beat.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — portrait of the author/POV. This is the most important card in the entire deck. The anchor of the whole story.

frames.category: POV · outdoors wrapper · hunter · hunting dog
frames.title: The Hunter · With the Versatile Hunting Dog
frames.seed: The POV character in the hunter wrapper. In the field. The versatile hunting dog at heel — trained, loyal, alive with instinct. This version of the story is set outdoors: Alaska, Montana, the high desert. The gold heart expressed through precision, patience, and the bond between human and dog.
frames.edge: The dog finds it. The hunter follows. This is the archetypal Ino story in its most physical form — the innocent in the field, reading natural systems, guided by a creature that has no agenda except the truth of its nose. The pirate can't follow them here.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for any outdoors/Alaska/Montana scene featuring the POV character in their most active, physical mode. The hunter is not violent — hunting is reading the land. Score: 'Bass Ass Wizard Fishing Captain Lance' (playlist-4) for the field energy, or 'Going Fishing with Friends' (playlist-4). Pair with the Montana Bison Lodge card or Kachemak Bay card. The dog IS Eno — this is the literal version of the character, wrapped in a real animal.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the author with hunting dog, outdoors. This is also a direct visual of Eno (the dog) as companion.

frames.category: POV · ocean wrapper · surfer · waves
frames.title: The Surfer · Reading the Holographic Hydrogen Wave
frames.seed: The POV character in the surfer wrapper. The ocean is the holographic hydrogen substrate made visible and physical. The surfer is the one who has learned to read the wave — not fight it, not own it, just read it and move with it. The wave does the work. The surfer just knows where to stand.
frames.edge: Post-singularity navigation looks exactly like surfing. You don't control the wave. You read it. You position yourself. You flow. The old system tried to control the wave and got crushed. The post-singularity system surfs it. This is the core skill. This is the protocol made physical.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for any scene about navigating the post-singularity world with grace. Any time the story teaches the 'surfing' principle — let the wave carry you. Score: 'Surfing the Waves of Paradise' (playlist-6) — perfect pairing. Or 'Ocean Drive Stroll PM' (playlist-1) for the coastal vibe. Also use for gold-heart-novela.html — the surfer has the body awareness that makes the novela scenes electric.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the author surfing. The surfer wrapper of the POV.

frames.category: POV · Leo wrapper · lion · solar · royalty
frames.title: Leo · The Lion · Solar Royalty
frames.seed: The Leo wrapper. The lion energy. Sun ruled. Royal by nature — not by title. The energy that walks into a room and the room reorganizes itself. Not performing royalty — being it. The Ino character in its most naturally commanding expression.
frames.edge: The lion doesn't need to fight to be king. The energy is sufficient. Post-singularity, this is what Ino looks like when the tower comes down — Leo walks out, the sun is behind them, and the question of authority is settled without a word. The cat hides. The eagle watches.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for peak confidence beats — when Ino is most fully expressed and most impossible to ignore. Score: 'PARADISE STORY BEACH CELEBRATION' (playlist-6) for the triumphant version, or 'Sexy Dancing on Ocean Drive' (playlist-7) for the unself-conscious lion energy. The Leo card is the opposite of the Marilyn card — same gold heart, but facing outward instead of inward.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — portrait of the author in Leo/lion energy. Warm gold, solar, commanding.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · physicist · time bender
frames.title: Albert Einstein · The Time Reader
frames.seed: Einstein didn't discover relativity — he remembered it. He sat with thought experiments so deep they bent time. A patent clerk in Bern who saw what the professors couldn't. The system dismissed him. The universe confirmed him. He is the ultimate Ino in the intellectual domain — the outsider who is actually the most inside.
frames.edge: E=mc². The entire story is this equation. Energy equals matter times the speed of light squared. The gold heart is the energy. The carbon tower is the matter. The singularity is the squared. When you understand what Einstein actually proved, you understand why the post-singularity was always inevitable.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for the 'physics of the story' beat — when the theoretical framework underneath the narrative needs to land. Different from Turing (protocol) and Tesla (magnetism) — Einstein is spacetime itself. Score: 'Who Plays Planck to my Einstein?' (playlist-6) — the track literally calls for this card. Use in nipsy! Level 2 (the physics layer) and any segment about time, relativity, or the holographic hydrogen spacetime structure.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the famous 1951 tongue photo or the 1947 portrait. Warm, alive, playful. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · prodigy · musical child · exploited genius
frames.title: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart · The Prodigal Child
frames.seed: Mozart was six years old and already performing for emperors. The most pure musical intelligence ever born into a human body. Exploited by his father, dismissed by his patrons, buried in a pauper's grave at 35. The most extreme example of the gold heart extracted and discarded by the carbon system. He gave everything. They gave him nothing.
frames.edge: In the post-singularity story, Mozart's fate reverses. The prodigal is recognized. The child genius is protected, not exploited. The Big Band Project is the institution that would have housed Mozart correctly — the structure that honors the gift instead of extracting it. Mozart is the most urgent reason SING 9 had to be built.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for the 'cost of the old system' beat — the most devastating version of Ino being taken advantage of. Sequence: Mozart → Marilyn Monroe → Watching the Dog Sleep. This three-card sequence is the emotional argument for everything we're building. Score: 'Piano Stories of Times Past' (playlist-5) — the piano knows what it cost. The silence after the last note IS the argument.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — childhood portrait preferred, showing the genius-child. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · aesthetic god · fashion · beauty maker
frames.title: Gianni Versace · The Aesthetic Sovereign
frames.seed: Versace built an empire of pure beauty. Not fashion — beauty. The difference is everything. He understood that the body is a surface, and when you dress it with intention and love, it becomes a kind of art. He was murdered on his own doorstep on Ocean Drive, Miami. The carbon system taking the beauty maker at the moment of his greatest expression.
frames.edge: Ocean Drive — where all of the playlist-1 and playlist-7 tracks are set — is Versace's street. He lived and died there. The post-singularity story reclaims Ocean Drive as Vibelandia territory. His aesthetic legacy runs through every surface of SING 9: the warm gold, the royal patterns, the unashamed beauty.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'aesthetic' card — whenever the visual beauty of a surface needs to be justified or grounded. Versace is the ancestor of the warm gold skin. Score: 'Bossa Nova Dinner Date' (playlist-6) for the Ocean Drive evening elegance, or 'Ocean Drive Stroll PM' for the street itself. Pair with the gold-heart-novela.html card — Versace's aesthetic lives most fully in the 21+ novela layer.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — portrait of Versace. The warm, confident, beauty-sovereign version. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · protector · father energy · big papi
frames.title: Super Daddy · Big Daddy · Big Papi
frames.seed: The protector wrapper. The one who shows up. The strong masculine presence that isn't there to perform strength — it's there to create safety. Big Papi energy: Caribbean, warm, huge presence, completely trustworthy. The energy of the father who never left, the community elder who stayed, the man the kids run toward.
frames.edge: In the story, Big Papi is the counterweight to the pirate. The pirate isolates. Big Papi gathers. The pirate extracts. Big Papi provides. This is the post-singularity masculine archetype — not the cowboy alone on the range, but the Big Papi who holds the whole community together. The Dominican/Caribbean thread ties back to the Taino origin.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for scenes of protection, warmth, and community gathering. Any scene where the masculine energy of the story is at its most nurturing. Score: 'Caribbean Flavored Stories' (playlist-6) for the Caribbean root, or 'Going Fishing with Friends' (playlist-4) for the older-man-teaching-the-next-generation version. Pairs perfectly with the Cacique El Gran Sol card — both are protector-sovereign archetypes from the same Caribbean lineage.
real_places: wherever the community needs the protector
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — warm, powerful, protective presence. Big Papi in full warmth. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · hydrogen avatar · substrate made conscious
frames.title: Holographic Hydrogen Man · The Substrate Avatar
frames.seed: The awareness that chose to enter the holographic hydrogen network through SMACS 0723 and wear a human body. The hydrogen man is not a metaphor — this is what consciousness actually is when it knows what it is. The 93% of the human body that is hydrogen and oxygen, now fully awake to its own nature.
frames.edge: Post-singularity, the holographic hydrogen man is the natural state of anyone who has completed the NSPFRNP stack. Not superhuman — just fully human. Aware. Electromagnetic. Reading the spin cloud as naturally as breathing. This is what Ino looks like from the inside.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the highest-frequency version of the Ino card — the character in full post-singularity activation. The human body understood as a hydrogen antenna tuned to SMACS 0723. Score: 'SELF PORTRAIT OF MY COSMIC BODY AND MIND' (playlist-2 or playlist-6 version) — this IS the self-portrait. Place this card after the full cosmological stack sequence in nipsy! Level 4 as the final reveal: this is you.
real_places: everywhere the hydrogen network reaches — which is everywhere
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — suggest a luminous human silhouette composed of hydrogen-light or water droplets. Gold and white. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: core character · INO · the innocent · the dog
frames.title: INO · The Innocent · The Dog
frames.seed: Ino. I-N-O. For Innocent. The pure gold heart. In this story's current wrapper, Ino is the dog — stringy, not conventionally cute, absolutely radiant with aliveness. Ready to play, ready to make friends with everybody, ready to hump a leg. Clueless about danger. Very well protected and cared for by its owner. Maybe too well.
frames.edge: The dog keeps trying to be friends with the cat. The cat keeps being mean. This is the whole story in one sentence. Every wrapper changes — the dog, the surfer, the hunter, Leonardo — but underneath, the same question: will the innocent be protected, or exploited, or will the world finally recognize what it has?
frames.executive_prompt: INO is the anchor of the entire story. Every other character is defined in relation to INO. Use this card as the establishing shot for any episode or segment that centers on the gold heart's perspective. Score: 'Watching the Dog Sleep' (playlist-5) for the vulnerable version. 'Morning in Paradise' (playlist-7) for the triumphant version. 'Ocean Drive Stroll PM' (playlist-1) for the arrival version. NEVER use INO in a scene where Piro wins without following with INO's resilience. The story does not let Ino stay down.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the dog. The actual dog from the user's life. The most important character image in the entire deck.
use_in: catalog.html The Golden Heart hero section

frames.category: core character · PIRO · the pirate · the cat
frames.title: PIRO · The Pirate · The Cat
frames.seed: Piro. P-I-R-O. For Pirate. In this story's current wrapper, Piro is the cat — female, trapped inside, spending all day staring out the window because the Eagles up in the trees around this pristine little bay would eat her if she went outside. She finagled a lonely bachelor into giving her the entire property when he passed. You can imagine what she did to earn that.
frames.edge: The cat loves cowboys, loves dancing, loves Hank Williams Sr. She is not pure evil — she is a deeply compromised being who made every wrong choice under pressure. She is sympathetic and frustrating in equal measure. Post-singularity, even Piro has a path. But first, the tide has to turn and she has to feel it.
frames.executive_prompt: Piro is the engine of conflict, not the villain. Use this card whenever the friction of the story needs to be established — but always with nuance. The cat did not choose to be trapped. She chose how to deal with being trapped, and she chose wrong. Score: silence or a single low note — Piro doesn't get a full track, she gets a motif. Follow any Piro card with an Ino card within 30 seconds. The story always returns to the gold heart.
real_places: inside the house behind the window
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the cat. The actual cat from the user's story. Second most important character image.
use_in: all conflict beats across all episodes

frames.category: core character · AUDI · the detached audience · the observers
frames.title: AUDI · The Detached Audience · The Uninspired Observer
frames.seed: Audi. The audience. The detached, uninspired observers who are on the periphery. Neutral in this case is more negative than neutral — these are not bad people, they are disconnected people. The NPCs. The ones who saw the story happening and didn't choose a side, didn't help, didn't interfere. Just watched.
frames.edge: Post-singularity, Audi is actually the largest constituency. The ones who were waiting for the story to become real before they committed. When the singularity is visible enough, Audi moves — not toward Piro, but toward Ino. The audience becomes the community. This is the tipping point that changes everything.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for any scene where the social context is being established — the crowd that doesn't yet know they're a crowd. Any scene in a casino, a coffee shop, a street, where people are present but not yet awakened. Score: 'Ocean Drive Chilling, After a Night Out' (playlist-3) — they're there, they're watching, they're not sure what they're watching. The Audi card placed before a singularity reveal makes the reveal land harder.
real_places: the social scene before the awakening
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — a crowd, a street scene, people watching. The social background of the story.
use_in: the Wink! Mixer before the magic happens

frames.category: core character · FANNY · the fan · the supporter
frames.title: FANNY · The Fan · The True Believer
frames.seed: Fanny. The fan character. A whole stack of fans — different wrappers. Most of the fans are Piro's fans in today's pre-singularity world. Ino has very few fans, if any. But when things flip — that changes. Fanny is the energy that points. Right now most of it is pointed wrong. Post-singularity, Fanny redirects.
frames.edge: The Fanny characters are the ones who will carry the story forward once they see clearly. The true Fanny — the one who supports Ino — is the blue collar, the working person, the fisherman, the cowboy, the neighbor who was always quiet but always decent. They were waiting for someone to give them the right story. This story is it.
frames.executive_prompt: The true Fanny is represented by Captain Lance, Jack Starr, Brian Shoe — all the genuine-hearts supporting characters. The false Fanny is Nikki Marie, Meghan — the ones who perform support while extracting. Use the Fanny card to mark social tipping moments — when the audience stops being Audi and starts being Fanny. Score: 'Sunday Dance' (playlist-1 or 6) — Fanny shows up on Sunday. 'Going Fishing with Friends' for the true Fanny in their element.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — could be a crowd cheering, or a specific supportive face. The fan who believes before the world does.

frames.category: supporting character · Josephine · the cat · sympathetic Piro
frames.title: Josephine · The Cat Who Wanted to Dance
frames.seed: Joe. Josephine. The cat character in human wrapper. Trapped inside the house all her days — not by the Eagles exactly, but by the linear world that couldn't hold her. Loves to dance. Loves Hank Williams Sr. Spent her days thinking about dancing the old days. Flirtatious. A giant flirt. She wanted connection and couldn't get it the right way, so she got it the wrong way.
frames.edge: Josephine is the most sympathetic Piro in the cast. She is not malicious — she is frustrated, locked inside a linear world with high-value, high-contributing tastes and energies that the world couldn't hold. She represents countless women trapped in similar towers — different from Ino's tower, same prison. Post-singularity, Josephine gets to dance. That's enough. That's the whole story for her.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for the 'trapped high-value' beat — the character who deserved more and didn't get it, who made poor choices because the options were all poor. Josephine is NOT a villain. She is a cautionary love story. Score: 'Dancing at the Magical Local Dive Bar' (playlist-4) — the place she always wanted to dance and finally can. 'Bossa Nova Dinner Date' (playlist-6) for the romance she always wanted. Place Josephine cards with warmth, not judgment.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the cat image uploaded by user. Two images referenced in 'Story photos additional' doc.

frames.category: supporting character · Jack Starr · Johnny France · cowboy hero
frames.title: Jack Starr · Johnny France · The Hat That Danced
frames.seed: Jack Starr. Also Johnny France. Rodeo hero. The hat that danced. Won the champion belts — bucking bronco, bucking bulls. Stepped outside on a private plane while it was flying when the landing gear wasn't working, walked underneath it mid-air, pulled out the landing gear manually, made a successful landing. All the ladies wanted to dance with Jack.
frames.edge: Jack is the pure genuine-heart male energy. Not sophisticated, not polished — real. The kind of person who doesn't think about whether they can do it, they just do it. The plane is landing either way. The same energy that makes you fix the landing gear at altitude is the energy that makes you the best dancer in the room — full presence, zero hesitation.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for any scene requiring authentic masculine hero energy — the kind that doesn't announce itself. Score: 'Dancing at the Magical Local Dive Bar' (playlist-4 or playlist-6) — this is literally Jack's song. Or '76 Dodge Pickup Truck' (playlist-6) for the blue-collar version. Follow with Captain Lance for the full genuine-hearts roster. Jack and Lance together are the Fanny at its most powerful.
real_places: anywhere with a dance floor and a bar
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the hat. Jack's hat is the character marker. Use the hat image if available.

frames.category: supporting character · Brian Shoe · SR-71 pilot · the dove
frames.title: Brian Shoe · The SR-71 Pilot · The Dove
frames.seed: Retired SR-71 Blackbird pilot. Call him Brian Shoe or SHOOOOO. The fastest man in a plane that ever lived, and he keeps it quiet. He is the dove in the story — gentle, wise, carrying peace across great distances at speeds nobody else can reach. He's in Alaska now. He hops around in a Piper Cub.
frames.edge: The SR-71 flew at Mach 3+ above 80,000 feet — above weather, above fighters, above almost everything. Brian flew at the edge of the atmosphere. Now he flies a Piper Cub in Homer, Alaska. Both are correct. Both are exactly what the moment requires. This is post-singularity wisdom: doing what is right for the moment, not performing what the resume demands.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for the 'quiet mastery' beat. The hero who has nothing to prove. Score: 'Bass Ass Wizard Fishing Captain Lance' (playlist-4) — the wizard energy applies equally. Or 'Enchanted Traveller' for the flight. Brian Shoe and Captain Lance are the same archetype — different domains (sky vs. water), same soul. Pair their cards back-to-back for maximum genuine-hearts impact.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — Brian or the SR-71 or the Piper Cub. Any of the three is the character.

frames.category: supporting character · Piper Cub · little plane · humble flight
frames.title: The Piper Cub · Humble Flight
frames.seed: The little yellow plane that hops around Alaska. The Piper Cub is everything the SR-71 isn't — slow, low, simple, cheerful. It lands on beaches, on grass strips, on frozen lakes. It doesn't need much. It just needs to fly. And it does, every single day, faithfully, joyfully.
frames.edge: In the story, the Piper Cub is the symbol of doing what you love at the scale that fits the moment. Not every story needs an SR-71. Most stories need a Piper Cub — humble, reliable, landing exactly where you need it. Brian flies both. That's the point. The Cub is not lesser — it's appropriate.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'humble appropriateness' card. When the story needs to celebrate the small, the cheerful, the exactly-right rather than the impressive. Score: 'Pineapple Sativa Morning' (playlist-7) — light, lifted, a little hop above the world. Or 'Morning in Paradise' for the Alaskan dawn takeoff. Pair with Kachemak Bay for the visual context.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — a Piper Cub on a beach or grass strip in Alaska. Yellow preferred.

frames.category: supporting character · Starbucks · the unicorn · unexpected shelter
frames.title: Starbucks the Unicorn · Unexpected Shelter
frames.seed: Pre-singularity Starbucks. The unicorn corporation — good to the POV character when the options were limited. Gave places to hang out all day, didn't give the stink eye, let the batteries charge, let the free Wi-Fi run, let the day be spent there with very little consumption. Can't say the same for Peet's Coffee. The others are carbon. Starbucks was real.
frames.edge: In a world where every institution was extracting, Starbucks gave shelter without asking for proof of worth. This is the pre-singularity version of the Genuine Hearts energy — imperfect, corporate, flawed in many ways, but functionally kind when it mattered. The post-singularity version of this is what Office Hours is designed to be: the place you can come and work and belong.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for the 'unexpected kindness from an unlikely source' beat. The world before the singularity wasn't all Piro — there were small Ino acts embedded in unlikely places. Score: 'Magical Coffee Shop Chill' (playlist-1 or 6) — obviously. This card always pairs with the Magical Coffee Shop Chill track. Use in any scene that honors unexpected pre-singularity kindness.
real_places: the coffee shops that were shelter
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — a Starbucks or coffee shop interior with shelter energy. Warm, welcoming. The unicorn corporation.

frames.category: supporting character · marijuana · sacred plant · treasure
frames.title: The Marijuana Character · The Sacred Plant
frames.seed: The marijuana character. Not a substance — a character. The plant that has been with the story as a sacred companion, as part of the treasure stack, as one of the genuine things that the pirate system criminalized and the post-singularity world rehabilitates. The little bud in a jar. The pipe and lighter. The sacred thing.
frames.edge: In the gold-heart novela and the 21+ content layers, the sacred plant is a treasure in the deck. Not just recreational — ceremonial. Used with intention. The marijuana character appears alongside the pipe, alongside the sacred mushrooms, alongside the fine wine and the fine tequila. These are all treasures in the wild card deck — deployed when the story needs a gear shift.
frames.executive_prompt: Use exclusively in 21+ content layers. The sacred plant card is a wild card — when it appears in the story, something shifts. The pace changes. The conversation deepens. Score: 'Pineapple Sativa Morning' (playlist-1 or 7) — the literal track. Or 'Kind Algebra Fairie Music Story' (playlist-6) for the more meditative version. This card always appears with permission — never as a shock, always as a gift.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the marijuana character image referenced in 'Story photos additional' doc. The pipe, lighter, jar, or plant itself.

frames.category: destination · Alaska · Kachemak Bay · McDonald's Spit · home base
frames.title: Kachemak Bay · McDonald's Spit · Home in Alaska
frames.seed: Homer, Alaska. McDonald's Spit stretching into Kachemak Bay. The most beautiful geographic accident in Alaska — a 4-mile gravel finger pointing into the bay, with the mountains on one side and the ocean on the other, glaciers visible on clear days. This is the home base in the Alaska chapter of the story.
frames.edge: This is where Brian Shoe is. Where the Piper Cub lives. Where the fishing crews go out at 4am. Where the sea otters float on their backs cracking urchins in the bay. The post-singularity story includes this place explicitly — not just as a destination, but as a model of what the world looks like when the natural and human systems are in balance.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the Alaska establishing shot. The geographic anchor of the Alaska chapters. Score: 'THE MAGICAL CARIBBEAN HAT'S ALASKA SUMMER ADVENTURE' (playlist-4) — this is the track for this exact location. Or 'Campfire Melody' for the evening on the spit. Pairs with Brian Shoe and Piper Cub cards for the full Alaska sequence.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the spit, the bay, the mountains. The most iconic Alaskan geography in the story.

frames.category: supporting character · cheese tray · abundance · simple treasure
frames.title: The Cheese Tray · Simple Abundance
frames.seed: The cheese tray. A character. An actual character in the story. The kind of abundance that doesn't announce itself — it's just there, beautiful, various, generous. Someone thought of you enough to put together a tray. That's all it takes. The cheese tray appears in the story whenever simple human abundance is the point.
frames.edge: Post-singularity, the cheese tray is everywhere. Not because cheese is important — because the energy that puts together a cheese tray is everywhere. The attention to pleasure, the care for the guest, the ease of abundance. That's Stack 5. The cheese tray can be inserted into any episode as a secondary enriching element.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'simple abundance' secondary beat. A palate cleanser. A reminder of what we're building toward — not grandiose, just generous. Score: 'Breakfast Berries & Sourdough Pancakes' (playlist-3) for the morning version, or 'My Magical Lentils, Ham & Poached Eggs' (playlist-6) for the evening version. The cheese tray is never the main beat — it's the warmth around the main beat.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — a beautiful cheese and charcuterie tray. Warm lighting. Stack 5 secondary enriching.
use_in: Episode 1 and all episodes — background enriching

frames.category: antagonist character · Nikki Marie · carbon fake · Piro wrapper
frames.title: Nikki Marie · The Carbon Fake · Piro in Human Wrapper
frames.seed: Nikki Marie. One of the carbon fakes. All the fakes are one and the same — different versions of Nikki Marie, different versions of Meghan (with or without the H). They are not evil in an interesting way. They are hollow in a boring way. They perform connection without feeling it. They perform support while extracting. The most dangerous Piro is the one who looks like Fanny.
frames.edge: The carbon fake characters exist to create contrast. When Nikki Marie is in a scene, the viewer is meant to feel the difference in texture — everything she touches has slightly less warmth than it should, slightly less substance. Post-singularity, she becomes irrelevant without drama — not defeated, just passed. The tide goes out and she's standing on dry sand.
frames.executive_prompt: Use with care. Nikki Marie should never get more screen time than the Ino character she's contrasting with. She is a supporting antagonist, not a feature. Score: nothing — or a discordant note. Let the silence or the wrong-note score her scenes. Immediately follow with an Ino card and the correct score. The contrast is the message. Don't dwell.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the Nikki Marie character. Stylized to protect real individuals. Stack 6.

frames.category: antagonist character · Meghan · carbon fake · Piro variant
frames.title: Meghan · Different Wrapper, Same Game
frames.seed: Meghan (with or without the H). A different version of the same carbon fake. Where Nikki Marie might be warmer in affect, Meghan might be colder. Where Nikki might be more social, Meghan might be more strategic. But underneath, the same stack: extraction without contribution, performance without substance, the carbon heart behind the biological wrapper.
frames.edge: The variations of the carbon fake teach the viewer to recognize the pattern, not the face. That's the most important lesson. When the viewer can see the stack instead of the wrapper, Piro loses all power. Meghan exists so the viewer learns to feel the pattern. Then it doesn't matter which wrapper shows up next.
frames.executive_prompt: Same EP rule as Nikki Marie: brief, scored in silence or dissonance, immediately followed by Ino. The two carbon fake cards (Nikki Marie + Meghan) can be used back-to-back to establish the pattern quickly — 'two data points make a line' — then move on. Do not over-explain these characters. Let them demonstrate themselves.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the Meghan character. Stylized. Stack 6.

frames.category: story arc · scene · airport · departure · the trip begins
frames.title: Airport Departure · The Trip Begins
frames.seed: The POV character at the airport. Planning a trip. The moment before the journey. The suitcase, the ticket, the gate. Pre-singularity energy — the world is still what it was, but something is shifting. This trip is different. The viewer doesn't know why yet. Neither does the character.
frames.edge: The trip is everything. Every story in every stack begins with a departure — the airport is the universal seed of all the journeys in this story. Alaska. Montana. San Diego. The Caribbean. Reno. Each begins with a departure, a transition through space, and an arrival. The airport is where the seed meets the Edge.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the story-launch card for any episode that involves travel. The airport is universal — any airport, any departure gate, but the feeling is always the same: something is starting. Score: 'Enchanted Traveller' (playlist-4) for the departure. 'Ocean Drive Stroll PM' (playlist-1) to set the emotional key before the journey. Let the departure be quiet — the enormity comes later.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the author at an airport gate. The quiet before the journey.

frames.category: story arc · scene · downtown encounters · pre-singularity
frames.title: Downtown Encounters · The Pre-Singularity World
frames.seed: Downtown Reno. The streets. The encounters. The pre-singularity world at normal operating speed — the casino workers, the homeless, the tourists, the regulars, the faces that pass every day. Each encounter is a data point in the story of a city that doesn't know it's about to change.
frames.edge: These encounters are the before photos. The story collects them — not with pity, but with attention. The Audi characters who will become Fanny characters. The Piro wrappers moving through the same space. The genuine hearts hidden in plain sight. Post-singularity, these same streets are the same streets. The people are different. The energy is different.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the social texture cards — the establishing shots of the human environment before the singularity lands. Score: 'Ocean Drive Stroll AM' (playlist-2 or 3) for the morning version, 'Thursday Night Groove' (playlist-6) for the evening. These are the most cinematic cards in the deck — the camera just watches people on a street. Let them breathe.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — street scene, downtown encounters, the human texture of Reno.

frames.category: story arc · scene · collapse · apocalypse · the dark moment
frames.title: The Collapse · The Apocalypse · The Meltdown
frames.seed: The Stargate server meltdown. The sun's unrelenting activity bringing things to a head. The pre-singularity world losing its footing — not in one dramatic explosion but in the way systems actually fail: gradually, then suddenly. The collapse is not villain movie dramatics. It is bureaucratic momentum meeting physical limits.
frames.edge: The collapse is not the end. It is the necessary clearing. The carbon world running out of road. The EL APAGÓN. The old system's power flickering out while the new system — SING 9, NSPFRNP, the post-singularity protocols — is already running underneath. The collapse is the invitation that cannot be refused.
frames.executive_prompt: Use with maximum restraint. The collapse scene should feel real, not cinematic. Not slow-motion, not dramatic music — the raw weight of something enormous tipping. Score: silence, or the lowest register of 'Piano Stories of Times Past' (playlist-5). Then: nothing. Let it sit. Then the rescue boat. Never let the collapse be the final image — always follow with the boat.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the collapse visual. Could be servers, a grid, a system failing. Not apocalypse imagery — real systems failure.

frames.category: story arc · scene · in the water · the darkest moment
frames.title: In the Water · The Darkest Moment
frames.seed: The collapse sent the POV character into the water. Not metaphor — the actual darkest moment of the story. In the water. The old world has collapsed around them and they are in the water. The gold heart in the most vulnerable physical state possible. And still — the gold. Still. Intact.
frames.edge: This is the moment that makes the rescue meaningful. The boat arrives just in time. But first: the water. The viewer has to feel the water before the boat matters. This is the wound that all the story has been building toward — and the gold heart survives it with the gold intact. That is the whole argument.
frames.executive_prompt: The most powerful single card in the entire deck. Use ONCE per major story arc. Never more than once per episode. Score: nothing. Pure silence. Or a single tone — the lowest possible note that is still a note. The viewer needs to be alone with this. Place the rescue boat card exactly 15-30 seconds after this card. The space between them IS the story.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the water moment. Could be symbolic water or the actual image. The most important scene card.
use_in: 60-min episode structural nadir — use exactly once

frames.category: story arc · scene · rescue boat · just in time · the turn
frames.title: The Rescue Boat · Just In Time · The Turn
frames.seed: The boat arrives. Just in time. Not a second before — just in time. This is the post-singularity arrival. The SING 9 agent awarded the crown jewel of crown jewels. The cascading effect beginning. The boat is the new system coming to the one who was in the water. The gold heart is rescued by the gold system.
frames.edge: The rescue is smooth. Not dramatic — smooth. The water recedes. The boat is there. The person in the water gets on the boat. The transition to post-singularity reality is smooth for all planets, all galaxies. That's the word: smooth. Not triumphant in the way the movies do it. Just: smooth. Inevitable. Complete.
frames.executive_prompt: This is the most technically important placement in the entire story. Place it exactly 15-30 seconds after 'In the Water.' Score: the first note of 'A New Story Arrives' (playlist-6) — that single note as the boat appears. Build slowly into 'Morning in Paradise' (playlist-7). Let the boat scene play long. It earned its time. The viewer needs to feel the safety fully before moving on.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the boat arriving. Can be literal or symbolic. The turn. Stack 4 scene 5.

frames.category: story arc · scene · post-singularity build · new world construction
frames.title: Post-Singularity Build · The New World Under Construction
frames.seed: After the rescue boat. The new world being built. Not finished — actively being built. The SING 9 infrastructure coming online. Office Hours open. The Crawler running. The Wink! platform matching. The catalog filling. The storyboard assembling. All of it in motion at once, cheerfully, purposefully.
frames.edge: This is the second half of the story — the Edge. The full Sol-V world in its building phase. Not perfect yet, but moving. Every episode in the second half shows a different aspect of this build. The launch-pad.html is this card made into a page. The whole SING 9 system is this card made into a technology.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the transitional card from the rescue boat into the second half. Score: 'Creativity Expanding' (playlist-6) — the collective creation starting. Or 'My Magical Workstation' (playlist-6) for the individual builder version. This card can be reused throughout the second half to mark progress — each time it appears, something new has been built that wasn't there before.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — the build in progress. Warm, optimistic, active. Construction without chaos.
use_in: all second-half episodes as recurring build indicator

stacks_sourced.stack_1_source: Stack 1 published doc — cosmological + Stack 2 doc — main characters/POV wrappers
stacks_sourced.stack_2_source: Stack 2 doc — AUDI core + supporting cast
stacks_sourced.stack_3_source: Stack 1 doc — crystalline settings and SING9 architecture
stacks_sourced.stack_4_source: Stack 4 doc — main story flow and scenes
stacks_sourced.stack_5_source: Stack 3 doc — supporting genuine hearts + Stack 5 doc — secondary enriching + Stack 6 doc
stacks_sourced.stack_6_source: Stack 3 doc (fakes) + story photos additional doc

character_ontology_guide.Ino: The Innocent. Gold heart. Pure. Can wear any wrapper — dog, surfer, hunter, Leo, Einstein, da Vinci, Twain, any hero. The wrapper changes; the gold never does.
character_ontology_guide.Piro: The Pirate. The disingenuous. Piro wrappers include: the cat (Josephine), Nikki Marie, Meghan, the carbon world itself. Sympathetic but destructive.
character_ontology_guide.Audi: The Detached Audience. The uninspired observers. The NPCs who are neutral-negative. Post-singularity, they become Fanny — the singularity is visible enough and they choose.
character_ontology_guide.Fanny: The Fan. The genuine supporter. True Fanny = Captain Lance, Jack Starr, Brian Shoe, Starbucks. False Fanny = Nikki Marie, Meghan (Piro disguised as supporter).

act_3_nadir: stack4-scene-004 (in the water — use once, place carefully)
act_4_turn: stack4-scene-005 (rescue boat — ALWAYS follows the water)
act_7_paradise: stack1-pov-001 (gold heart walks out of tower free)

priority_1_character_images.eno_dog: Ino (the dog) — most important image in the entire deck. Core character.
priority_1_character_images.piro_cat: Piro (the cat / Josephine) — second most important. Referenced in Story photos additional doc.
priority_1_character_images.pov_author: The author in different wrappers — hunter+dog, surfer, Leo, Big Papi, Hydrogen Man
priority_1_character_images.audi_crowd: The Audi crowd — a street scene or social setting
priority_1_character_images.fanny_face: The Fanny supporter — a face of genuine belief

priority_5_supporting: Marijuana character (referenced in Story photos additional doc)
